title: @LCU Designers: Clarity in the Client
body:
_Just a quick write up on clarity issues in the client:_

Some features of the client, specifically Masteries are really lacking clarity ATM. It's far too hard to see what I've selected. The brightness for the masteries I select needs to be much higher IMO.

https://i.gyazo.com/dcba585e40818cb807606eb12d6345a1.png

> In that picture, I can hardly see the luminosity difference between Runic Armour and Veteran's Scars. The Keystone I selected is hardly visible as well. If not for the border I probably wouldn't be able to tell it was even selected. 
> 
> **When I'm about to go in-game this information needs to be VERY clear and right now this isn't cutting it.**


__*

Aside from masteries, I think in general the client is too dark. I get you're going for a different feel to the old client, but it shouldn't be at the expense of clarity. 

_**Here are some side by side comparisons: **_

Champions:
http://i.imgur.com/D3co6Wv.png

Runes:
http://i.imgur.com/ZX3L2Yc.png

Hopefully someone from the design team is generous enough to read through this. Also if anyone disagrees or has feedback please comment down below if you can.

Thanks for reading :)

replies.body:
Thanks for the feedback Telecasterdude, I'll pass this on to the design team so they can take a look :)

Cheers
Mindstar
Hey thanks for taking the time to read and comment man :D
I still believe that the masteries are hard to see still. It'd be cooler if there was some sort of glow on the selected items. Or if the icons selected were shining.

i just feel the champion tiles colours are too dull when you are not hovering the mouse cursor over them, if they were as bright as the hover over but just without the border that would be much better
I was thinking exactly the same thing so I sent in a feedback form too, and IMO the champions page suffers from the same problem as the masteries

Can I also point out that it looks really weird to have the masteries titles (cunning, ferocity and resolve) feel weird and out of place when shown on the top instead of on the bottom like as seen on the legacy client. It just feels weird and out of balance as if it is going to topple over because the amount of white space on the bottom.
